intro: Turrita hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy turrita, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in dry, open habitats. Turrita hirsuta is generally not cultivated but can be seen in wildflower meadows and disturbed soils.
